Description: Russian is an East Slavic language spoken primarily in Russia and parts of Eastern Europe and Asia.

InterethnicLanguage: Moldova (Gagauzia, Left Bank of the Dniester)

RegulatedBy: Russian Language Institute at the Russian Academy of Sciences
AdditionalInfo: Russian is the most spoken Slavic language and the most spoken native language in Europe.
It is one of the six official languages of the United Nations.
Russian is written in the Cyrillic alphabet and features 'soft' and 'hard' sounds in its phonemes.
The language has notable lexical similarities with Bulgarian due to a common Church Slavonic influence.
Russian has been influenced by Western and Central European languages, Uralic, Turkic, Persian, Arabic, and Hebrew.
It is classified as a level III language in terms of learning difficulty for native English speakers.
Russian is widely used in the former Soviet Union countries and beyond.
